double.translation[0].definitions[0].def: consisting of two parts that are similar or exactly the same
double.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the great double doors of the cathedral
Don’t park your car on double yellow lines.
double.translation[0].definitions[1].def: combining or involving two things of the same type
double.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: A lot of the jokes were based on double meaning.
double.translation[0].definitions[2].def: twice as big, twice as much, or twice as many as usual
double.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The city was enclosed by walls of double thickness.
double.translation[0].definitions[3].def: made for two people or things to use
double.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Do you need a double bed or two singles?
double.translation[0].definitions[4].def: used to say that a particular letter or number is repeated
double.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: My name’s Robbins with a double ‘b’.
double.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a double flower has more than the usual number of petals
double.translation[1].definitions[0].def: something that is twice as big, as much etc as usual or as something else
double.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Scotch and water, please – make it a double.
double.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a room for two people in a hotel
double.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a hit in baseball which allows the batter to reach second base
double.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: Walker led the inning with a double.
double.translation[1].definitions[3].def: an actor who takes the place of a more famous actor in a film, especially because the acting involves doing something dangerous
double.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: I think they used a double in the shower scene.
double.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to become twice as big or twice as much, or to make something twice as big or twice as much
double.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The church has doubled its membership in the last five years.
Within two years the company had doubled in size.
A promise was given to double the number of police on duty.
double.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: Take a sheet of paper and double it over.
double.translation[2].definitions[2].def: to hit the ball far enough to get to second base in a game of baseball
double.translation[4].definitions[0].def: twice as big, twice as much, or twice as many
double.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: The value of the house is double what it was.
We’ll need double this amount for eight people.
double.translation[5].definitions[0].def: twice as big, twice as much, or twice as many as usual, or twice as big, much, or many as something else
double.translation[5].definitions[0].exa: The number of men receiving professional degrees today is still nearly double that of women.
double.translation[6].definitions[0].def: something that is nearly twice the size, quantity, value, or strength of something else
double.translation[6].definitions[0].exa: ‘What did they offer you?’ ‘Ten thousand.’ ‘I’ll give you double.’
double.translation[7].definitions[0].def: to become twice as much or as many, or to make something twice as big
double.translation[7].definitions[0].exa: The costs of providing medical insurance for employees has doubled in recent years.
GE plans to more than double the size of its railcar leasing operation.
